description: Students begin learning Spanish in an intercultural context. The course introduces the Spanish-speaking world through exploration of topics, for example: the geography of the Spanish speaking world; Mexico, our neighbor; and ecotourism. In-class speaking, listening, reading, and writing activities are complemented by attendance at two required culture tables. Open only to students with no prior experience in Spanish or who have placed into Spanish 111. Offered fall semester and Interim. Does not count toward Spanish major.
name: Intro Spanish Language/World I
notes: IMPORTANT: Open to students who placed into SPAN 111 or students who have
never studied Spanish in a classroom setting.
title: Introduction to Spanish Language and the Spanish-Speaking World I
